instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No spill. Not recognizing SSD's intermittently.
threads.message: This board has no sign of a spill. SSD will sometimes work fine and I'm able to clone it and even boot to it. And then randomly, and fairly often, it will turn on to the question mark folder, or if I option-boot, there the SSD will not show up as an option. I've tried 3 known-good 2017 SSD's and they all behave identically. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No spill. Not recognizing SSD's intermittently.
threads.message:
Check J8600, <CHIP>U8640</CHIP> and nearest components.
Be sure both L8600/02 are OK.
Resolder all components there, and pay atention to J8600 terminals.
